let's first cover some
definitions AWS Network firewall is a
managed service that makes it easy to
deploy essential Network protections for
all of your Amazon
vpcs with network firewall you can
filter traffic at the perimeter of your
VPC this includes filtering traffic
going to and coming from an internet
gateway net Gateway or over VPN or AWS
Direct
Connect Network firewall includes
features that provide protections from
common Network threads Network firewall
stateful firewall can incorporate
contexts from traffic flows like
tracking connections and protocol
identification to enforce policies such
as preventing your vpcs from accessing
domains using an unauthorized
protocol Network firewalls intrusion
prevention system provides active
traffic flow inspection so you can
identify and block vulnerability
exploits using signature-based
detection Network firewall also offers
web filtering that can stop traffic to
known bad URLs and monitor fully
qualified domain
names next manage role groups are
collections of predefined ready to use
rules that AWS writes and maintains for
you the surra cotta homet variable of
the manag rule group has the classless
interdomain routing also known as cider
range which is inspected by the network
firewall previously you were unable to
override this variable by default it
used the CER range of the VPC where
firewall was
deployed now if your firewall uses a
central inspection VPC this led to a
situation where Network firewall
populated a home net variable with the
CER ranges of the inspection VPC instead
of the application or spoke vpcs which
you would would want to filter with the
option to override the variable it is no
longer a challenge I'll walk you through
the steps of setting up this override to
include deider ranges of all the vpcs
that you want to
inspect you can override the syot henet
variable in firewall policies using the
Amazon VPC console awli or the network
firewall API for this demonstration I'll
